column4: if an iso write keep failing at the same file is it a bad iso or bad disk?
what error message do you get? hard to know without that =(
did you get a md5 file with the iso, or did your burner program create it prior to burning?
so you created it yourself prior to burning?
and then when the cd is burnt the image written to the disc fails the check?
sounds like a broken disc imho, could be broken cd-burner/cd-reader, but broken disc is most likely
try burning some other iso to that same cd-rw
and you'll know if it's the cd-rw that fails
take a look at http://www.distrowatch.com for a lot of different isos =)
it failed with another iso too?
you could try using instlinux if you want to install without adding any other bootable media
http://sourceforge.net/projects/instlux it only does ubuntu 6.06, but you can always upgrade
